Posts.Content: Hi Bonnie: thank you for information. I actually started treatment yesterday. Herceptin and navelbine. Double dose of herceptin for three weeks, my treatments will be three weeks on and 1 week rest. After the first three doc is going to do scans to see if tumors are shrinking, that is the hardest part, waiting to see if something is working. I also have pain in my side the doc said, it was from my liver being enlarged. thank you for taking the time to send me a message all the info I can get I greatly apprenciate and just chating with someone who knows what I'm talking about and how it feels is a great comfort.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Thomas: Thank you for the information I will look it up and see if that is something that could be done for BC that mets to the liver. Good luck with your dad, I will put him in my prayers.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Gail: I would love to chat with you about our treatments and such, you are the first person I have found that actually has breast cancer in the liver. Hope to hear from you soon. Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: I just found out that my cancer spread to the liver I finished radiation in Feb. I had scans done in May and something showed up on the liver but, was told it was nothing. Now here I am stage IV and scared to death. I see doctor tomorrow to find out I guess what can be done if anything. Any one else with breast cancer that has metastasis to the liver? Would love to have someone to talk to about this.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Thanks Laura is has been hard finding info, about breast cancer in the liver I will check out the sites. Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon: I can relate very much to your feelings.It has been three years since my orignal diagnose of BC, and two years since it met to the liver. I have been through chemo twice and radiation. I have been on Herceptin two years the end of this month. I go every other week for treatment. I am in remission. I had another lump removed in the other breast in July, came back benigh.I have had all types of feelings and fears over the last three years. The one thing I have found was to think positive and keep moving. I know that sounds kinda crazy to you right now. Believe me I was a basket case at times and cried. I pulled my boot straps up and decided I wouldn't let the cancer ruin my life. It is hard at times. I don't know what type of support you have, I hope you do have someone to help you, even if it is to talk to. I have pretty much been the strong one in my family. I don't think my husband has really accepted that I even have cancer. I have found great comfort in meeting people just like you on line to chat with, compare with even cry sometimes. It's good to have someone that knows about the feelings and what we each go through. I will keep you in my prayers. I didn't get sick through either times I had chemo. The only problem I am having now is my blood pressure has crept up and I am having a hard time losing weight, my doctor told me he liked fluffy patiences I told him I didn't like being fluffy..lol If you want to talk or ask any questions please do. I went through a roller coaster of emotions in the beginning. Don't get me wrong I have a pity party every now and then...but, who don't. Ask lots of questions of your doctor, that is one thing I didn't do the first round. I changed doctors and he listens to me and explains things to me that made a big difference in how I also felt about my cancer. Well, hang in there hope to hear from you soon. Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Good Morning Sharon. I am glad your first treatment wasn't to bad. It does seem once you get through that first one it helps a little with the stress of thinking about getting it. I can also relate to your friends not wanting you to say certain things, I also had that problem even with my husband. I think it is something we need to say out loud, I know I had all these thoughts and was afraid. Like you everyone thinks that I am this strong brave person to fight this battle, I don't complain to any of them because when I did their response was don't give up. Just because I wanted to scream or cry or just felt really bad did not mean I gave up. I got so much advice I wanted to scream. I feel we are entiltled to have a bad day just like everyone else. I have found in my three years of fighting that people that don't have cancer don't understand or maybe they don't want to. I think my husband is still in denial. I know in the beginning when I found out my BC had met to the liver, I couldn't believe it. I also constantly thought about my future. It is very hard in the beginning when you are trying to digest it all. Then you have to have all these scans, it's frightening you don't know what to expect. I know when the week before my surgery I had to have a muga scan,bone scan,cat scan, Pet scan and a chest xray. I kept thinking with all this radiation they were going to give me cancer. It is an emotional roller coaster. Even now there are days that it just hits me and I feel sad all day and cry. It don't happen as much now, I try to keep as busy as I can it does help. I get treatment every other wed. I am getting Herceptin. I am at my two year mark as of the 27th of getting Herceptin. I get my scans done every six months that is when I get pretty emotional and stressed waiting for the results. I have read so many books and chated with so many BC survivors all the feelings we have are normal, what ever normal is :) You hang in there and what ever you need to say, say it don't hold all that in. I have learned the hard way. Even if I don't have anyone to talk to I write it out. If someone says things to me I don't like or tells me not to say this or that I write it out like I am telling them what it feels like. When I am really angry at the cancer or someone else I tend to tell them off on paper then I throw the paper away, it sounds crazy but someone it makes me feel better. Well I have talked your ear off with this email. Looking forward in hearing from you. You hand in there..:) Your Friend Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Good Morning Sharon: yes I am in the states, unfortunately this messsage board does not allow us to exchange email addresses. I think that would really help a lot of people on here to have someone to chat with and email back in forth instead of posting messages. Oh well.. Just take everything one day at a time. I use to tell myself that tomorrow will be better, sometimes it was. I know this is all so scary. I found out I had BC six months after my mother passed away from cancer. It was pretty hard I wasn't over her death and had to deal with cancer myself. Every time I have to have my scans I get so emotional and stressed out, that it is out of remission. I think we all stay on some kind of emtional roller coaster. I do know how you feel about the news sinking in, I didn't cry or get upset until after my second chemo and my hair started falling out that's when it really hit me, I was a basket case for a while. I had my husband shave my head I couldn't stand it coming out in clumps. I was still working, I was a manager in a bank. It was really hard trying to wear a wig. I finally quit my job after sixteen and a half years. I couln't take the stress of the job and my employer giving me problems on top of fighting for my life with the treatment. I know things kind of get worst before it gets better, emotional anyhow. Try to eat good things, cut down on sugar. Drink lot's of water especially the day of and after your treatment. Talk to your doctor about vitamins. I don't know if I am any help or maybe making you feel worst. I hope it is not the latter. I am here for you. Wish I could go to your treatment with you. Well, hang in there, cry if you feel like it, even scream and holler sometimes just getting all that out makes you feel better. Until our next chat..take care hang in there Your new friend Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, I just realized you posted. I didn't get anything from the site to let me know there was a post. I can relate to being on another planet I still feel like that sometimes..lol I am glad the tumor markers are going down. I am doing pretty good. This time of the year is hard for me for some reason I guess because I have no family here except my husband. you hang in there think positive...I do think attitude has a lot to do with how we cope. There are days when I just cry for no reason but most of the time I'm hanging tough... Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Mary: It sounds like I am having the same treatment as you had. Do you know how long it took for the tumors to shrink? And did you have pain in your liver? Thank you for sending message we can use all the support we get. Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Spring: My prayers are with you and your sister. As for me well it has been over a year since my cancer came back and I am doing great. I went through chemo again this time navelbine and herceptin. I was half way through my chemo "navelbine" and had scans done all the tumors were gone. My doctor stopped the chemo but I still get the herceptin I was going every week, as of this month I am going every other week. I also take femara. As for the diet well, I eat lots of vegs and fruit. I really don't like red meat any more I think it taste nasty. When I was going through chemo the first time I got taxol among others and was pretty sick at the beginning, the only thing that really tasted good was steamed veg. and grape juice was the only drink that tasted good. Everyone is different, your sister needs to try different things until she finds something that really taste good. I also took three different antinause drugs which really helped. I have also leared that a positive attitude is everything....when my hair grew back I got this funky little hair style all spiked and I just tell myself everyday, that today is the best day of my life even if I feel bad, I look in the mirror and tell myself to suck it up..I really think changing my attitude has helped me. I don't mean to ramble. I wish you and your sister all the best. the hardest thing for me was not being able to find anyone who had cancer that met to the liver. I really think we need each other because we can really relate to all that is happening to us and what we feel. I have met a lot of women and men who have cancer through my infusion lab. When we get a new patience my nurses put me in the room with them so they will have someone to talk to that has been there. I love it, I have met the most wonderful people and have become friends with quite a few of them. I pass out my phone number to any one that might like to have someone to talk to or just go out and do things..I hope all is going well just hang in there and don't give up hope.I have met some great ladies on here, we exchanged email address and a few even phone numbers. Here is my email --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html --- God Bless Juia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon: Was thinking about you today, hope your first treatment went okay. I am keeping you in my prayers.. Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Denise: Thank you for the information. I am 48 and was diagnosed last year, and the lymphs were involved. I did eight chemo treatments every two weeks 36 radiation treatments and started on Tamoxifen in April, it seems something didn't work since it spread so fast. I am estrogen positive also. I started treatment Monday, navelbine and herceptin every week for three weeks then I will have scans done to see if it is working. I will ask my doctor about your treatment to see if that is something I should do. The more info we have the better. Thank you so much for responding to me. I would be happy to continue to chat with you.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Barbara: My treatment just started on Monday, navelbine and herceptin three weeks on and one week off. I am also taking tamoxifen. I found out I had breast cancer last June 2003. so this has all happened so fast I knew that someday it would come back but, not this soon and in the liver. I finished radiation in Feb. this sure is a scary world and it can be quite lonely. thank you so much for the email. I would love to get emails or chat with any one that would be intersted. My email address is Jsweetpea2@aol.com.. Julia I am hanging in there I will fight to the end...
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Ann: It seems we have a lot in common. I was orginally diagnosed in 2003 mine came back in the liver 2004. I will be 50 this year.. :) I did not have any problems with the navelbine or Herceptin. The only problem for me was my red count would go down and I would get pretty tired, I had to get aranespt shot for the count. I think I spelled that right. I still get the Herceptin I go every other week. I gained quite a few pounds since all my treatment, I think the most was from the steroids. I joined curves in January, I walk two miles a day and I also dance on the days I don't go to curves. The pounds are pretty stubborn and don't seem to want to come off but, I enjoy getting out. I just keep telling myself to keep moving..believe me some days it is hard. I am not saying I don't have a bad day now and then I think that is natural with what we go through. I am always looking for someone to talk to that has the same treatment as me or that the cancer met to the liver. We are truly the only ones that understand each others feelings. I wish we could exchange email addresses. Some sites that I go to you can which is great, I met a lady that only lives about forty minutes from me. You hang in there and please do reply to my message I am here if you want to talk or vent or what ever you need. I live in Maryland, where do you live? You take care, Julia
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Metastasi to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Joeaz: I was first diagnosed with BC in 2003 I went through chemo, radiation took Tamoxifen in August 2004 my tumor markers went up, my cancer had spread to my liver. I started on chemo - Navelbine and Herceptin. In January of this year I had scans done NO CANCER showed anywhere in my body. I stopped the Navelbine but, still get the Herceptin and was switched from Tamoxifen to Femara. The treatment seems to be working for me. I have met two women at the infusion lab who have the same and it has been seven years for them. I do excersise and try to watch what I eat. I just turned 49. My biggest problem is I gained about forty pounds with the steroids and the Tamoxifen. I think there is hope for us. I keep a positive attitude and keep moving. I have found that most of my so called friends stopped calling or coming around and some family memebers seem to have a hard time seeing me for some reason. For me the hardest part was not having a lot of support through my family and friends. I keep my good attitude, keep moving and I suck up the pain in my joints from the meds. Try to get as much info as you can about your treatment, what options you have ask questions. I go every week for the Herceptin and it seems I always have a question about something. My doctor will take the time to explain things or if I read something that I think I could do , he will explain to me why I can't ....so hang in there.... Dimples
Posts.Title: Stage 4

Posts.Content: Hi Patricia: I just started on herceptin and navelbine, my breast cancer met to the liver. I am taking tamoxifen also. I am having double dose of herceptin for the first three treatments which are every week. The fourth week I will be having scans done again to see if it is working. I am so grateful for the message boards I have found so much information and some wonderful people to chat with that understand what this all feels like. Julia
Posts.Title: Metastisizing Breast Cancer, Third Time

Posts.Content: Hi: I am 49 and my bc met to the liver after 1 year of my orginal diagnois. I had a lumpectomy, chemo and radiation the first go round. When it met to the liver I went through chemo Navelbine and Herceptin. After half of my treatments with the navelbine I had all scans done and all the tumors were gone..doc stopped the navelbine but kept me on Herceptin. I having been getting Herceptin since Sept of 2004 and so far so good..I haven't had any problems except maybe a few aches and pains from the Femara which I was switched to since the cancer met when I was taking tamoxifen. I was going every week for the herceptin in Nov the doc changed it to every two weeks. I didn't get sick with either of these drugs, I did have to take sternoids which I think is the standard and put on a few pounds but I ask to be taken off of the sternoids and he did take me off of them. I joined curves in Jan to help get me back into some kind of shape. I walk everyday that really seems to help it even helped when I was really tired. It's a hard road we travel but , a good attitude and having a part and a say in our treatment I feel really helps. I am not saying I didn't have any bad days because believe me I did. I just keep telling myself tomorrow will be better. I allow one pity party day a month ..lol I don't know if any of this helps you in any way. I hope it does..I do know how you feel. I found out my cancer had came back some where in my body on my birthday what a present. my tumors markers went way up, then I had the scans done. So I didn't know where it had came back until after all the scans. It's so stressful waiting for results or knowing it's there but, where... I hope you can hang in there ask lots of questions, I changed ono's twice because I didn't like the way I felt they treated me. That is our right too...I have agreat doctor now he listens, jokes discusses things with me. didn't mean to ramble on so much. hang in there. I do hope you have someone you can really talk to about your feelings and it's okay to cry. I actually met the best on chat rooms I have become great friends with two ladies that live in other states. That I think has helped me the most, they know exactly how I feel because they have it too...I have actually met one of them in person and we both feel like we have known each other for ever.. Dimples
Posts.Title: Mets to The Liver

Posts.Content: Hi Galine: I also had 4 rounds of A/c and 4 of taxol every two weeks. I had a lot of bone pain I also had to do the shots for white count. I had neuropathy in hands and feet. I hurt so bad I had to quit my job or they would have fired me, for calling in. I finished that chemo last Nov 27th. All the feeling came back in my hands and feet it took a long time I actually just started feeling like my feet were normal in Sept. I know the treatments are hard. I am now on another round my BC spread to the liver. I will do what ever it takes to beat this the best I can. I am not ready to give up. I know it is hard for other people to tell you what you should do, just try to hang in there. I have met some wonderful people on here, that email me and we compare treatments or just talk about how we feel that has been my greatest comfort, meeting people that know what it feels like. It's okay to have a pity party day I do at least once a week and even have a good cry sometimes then I feel better and move on. It's hard to talk about your feelings with people that don't really know what it feels like. I don't mean to ramble you just sound a little like me when I was going through all the bone pain. Julia
Posts.Title: Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, it seems we were the same age when finding out we have cancer. I was first diagnoised with stage III in 2003. I had the brittle nails they also turned yellow. I also had swelling with no explanation. Doctor told me to watch salt intake. Chemo also put me through menopause and my emotions were something else, there were days that I would just cry and not know why. I have changed doctors three times because I felt I was not getting the proper care. I wanted a doctor who would listen to me and take the time to talk to me and I have finally found one. I would be happy to chat with you or be here to compare treatments and side effects. Julia
Posts.Title: Swelling Feet , Ankles, and Abdomen -help

Posts.Content: Hi Bobbi: I was in the same situation you are in, except I was trying to work and take off a day or two here and there when was necessary from the side effects. My employer hired someone to take my position with me still working and then had the nerve to ask me to train them. They did everything in their power to get me to quit. They wrote me up because I didn't want to wear a wig when I lost my hair. It became so stressful I finally just quit. I tried complaining too. I even went as far as contacting the EEOC. I could have sued them for some of the things they did to me. Fighting my cancer had to be number one and like you said, putting myself first for once. I just did not have the strength to fight them.My cancer was enough of a fight and I just could not deal with all the stress any more. I worked with my supervisor for sixteen years. I know how you feel. I am now on Herceptin and have been for a year now. When I was told I was stage IV my nurse told me to try and apply for disability so I did and was approved. Have you considered applying for disability? I can now fight my cancer with that positive attitude and not worrying when I need to take a nap or go for my treatments and just enjoy life. Good luck to you. Dimples
Posts.Title: my Postion is Being Filled Once my Fmla is Exhausted
